alert.note: Alert for Christian; Morgan; Sangamon (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 11:25PM CDT until June 26 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Christian County in central Illinois... Southwestern Sangamon County in central Illinois... Southeastern Morgan County in west central Illinois... * Until 230 AM CDT. * At 1124 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Taylorville, Chatham, Auburn, Pawnee, Kincaid, Waverly, Divernon, Edinburg, Franklin, Bulpitt, Jeisyville, Thayer, Tovey, Berry, Glenarm, Sicily, Sangchris Lake State Park, Roby and Sharpsburg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
